title: Tips about performance
text: The interface is all good no problem but have handread issuis like hashtags not working well and you can't posts in feed , and crashing while try to type something , yes i know everything will be fixed but we want be a perfect fix, cause the platform is awsome, and dont forget we want better version for browser (PC), thanks for developers

title: Great idea
text: I definitely think this app is a good idea but it‚Äôs missing a few key features that still make Twitter better such as having a following tab so I can just see threads from the people I follow, a notifications tab so I can see the threads that I turned notifications on for without having to search for them after I open the app, if those two things were implemented this app could be better than Twitter

title: I can‚Äôt post and I don‚Äôt know why!!!
text: For some reason, never explained to me, I can‚Äôt post til next week. It was never been explained why or what I did to experience this. Also I don‚Äôt get breaking news here. It‚Äôs hard to navigate without trending topics or an explore feature. Overall I like the app and being able to talk to people about different things I‚Äôm interested in. But it‚Äôs been a mixed experience so I still use Twitter as well.

title: Great Place to Socialize
text:
As soon as Threads was up and running it was goodbye Twitter/X. From infancy to now there have been changes for the better, and still growing. I can find groups and people with like interests easily, and block that may not be to my liking. 

Threads is a fun safe space and I would recommend checking it out.

title: Repost to Insta doesn‚Äôt work for me
text: I‚Äôve reposted my Threads posts multiple times to Instagram and many of my friends tell me that when they try to view my Stories, they get a message that it‚Äôs unavailable. I thought it was strange that those Stories had single-digit viewers, when ‚Äúnormal‚Äù Stories posted right after that aren‚Äôt Threads reposts get many more (just the usual). There seems to be a bug with the repost to Instagram feature.

title: Better then twitter in my opinion
text: I do enjoy the layout of this app more then twitter. However I see to many posts from people I don‚Äôt follow and have no interest in following. So I think a page for recommended content separate from the content from people I already follow would be a good idea. I have noticed that the people‚Äôs content from who I follow appears first. 9/10

title: As of right now, it‚Äôs great!
text: To be fair, there‚Äôs only 2 million or so users so far, but the app seems stable, it‚Äôs mostly running smoothly, the U.I. Makes sense and leads to a fairly clean UX. And my favorite part as of right now, everyone‚Äôs posting happy and/or positive things. No personal, political, or in-fight focused posts in my feed. Hopefully the algo keeps it that way! üôÇ

title: This App is fun!
text: It‚Äôs like joining in on a private, but still group discussion. I like X because it‚Äôs a BIG discussion. But I like Threads because it‚Äôs an intimate discusion. I just wish I could delete one or the other if I chose. OR it could be better integrated into IG. Reguardless, I‚Äôm having fun on this app and I am hopeful, curious, and excited to see what happens next for this app.

title: It has potential:)
text:
Ok so I‚Äôm liking what I‚Äôm seeing for a first version of this app. I definitely think it has the potential to be a serious Twitter competitor. But it‚Äôs really barebones. 

It‚Äôs missing hashtags, a trending page, and search. These things are like the essentials for a discussion app lol. It‚Äôs ok because the app is still new, but these features should come out ASAP.

Some other features we could use are bookmarks, and a way to see past likes. We should be able to have more control over who appears on our feed. Plus some UI improvements, but that will come with time.

If y‚Äôall can get these features out I think it‚Äôll be an awesome competitor to Twitter. We‚Äôre rooting for you üßµ

title: No

title: Best thing about it is the community
text:
You may have noticed the sharp turn to the right another popular social media platform has taken since its rebranding. 

There seems to be much less hate on Threads, much friendlier environment in 

The app has made steady improvement week over week. I recommend it over other similar services.

title: Get out of my feed

title: Huge disappointment
text: Within minutes of making a profile & integrating my IG, I started checking out the app. Way to many posts from people I don‚Äôt follow. There‚Äôs no way to disable reposts, that I can see. You know how contacts on your phone are there cuz of YOUR decision? Threads is NOT like that. You‚Äôre inundated by posts from people you don‚Äôt know. You spend more time blocking/scrolling past/muting accounts you don‚Äôt follow vs any content you have interest in (the people you follow)

title: Needs more features/functions
text:
Great start but needs immediate improvements if you want to bring in and retain customers outside of Instagram who prefer to socialize by text then photos, to include: 
 - Feed to capture posts of only those you follow, with option to have separate recommendations feed (which I don‚Äôt want)
- Automatic translation for all posts or button/link to translate any post (because most of my interests are overseas like Japan) 
- Ability to create lists of accounts you don‚Äôt follow but are interested in their occasional posts (for example: news, health, lifestyle, etc) 
- Edit button 
- Trends feeds
- Ability to switch locations (because of interests, and therefore see different trends in different countries)
Thanks!

title: Good
text: Good food overall but the service was lacking. Once i got to the fifth chapter the storyline began to crumble. The characterization of Spongebob was beautiful in the fact that there were so many plot twists. When he turned on Patrick in chapter 17 when he lets a boat crush him. But all in all the storyline held up and the soundtrack was made better by Yeat and Morgan Wallen

title: Threads

title: Threads sure is better than others.
text: I left Facebook and now Twitter (x) because of all the hatred, chaos, anger, and propaganda. Most of the good, decent people were already here on Threads. It‚Äôs been refreshing and life affirming. People talk to each other and are kind and informative without name calling and way fewer trolls. Thanks threads!

title: Necessary improvements
text:
The app is nice. However, users should be able to search up specific threads on a topic.   users should also be able to see what‚Äôs trending for them, in their country and around the world. Finally users should be presented with thread topics that is based on their interests. 

With these necessary additions I can see my self permanently committing to the Threads app.

title: Love it! Just a few tweaks tho
text: Just like twitter but betterrrrr. So much better seriously. The only tweak I have in mind is double tapping a thread to like it because I‚Äôve been doing that forever on instagram. I also like how I can see Al the random peoples threads it‚Äôs more interesting that way. Thanks insta! We don‚Äôt want twitter or ‚Äúx‚Äù anymore!!

title: Has potential, but also secretive
text: Threads seems pretty tight lipped about what they are doing in the background. Updates are just ‚Äòbug fixes and performance enhancements‚Äô which seems a little off for a brand new app. If you do some digging you can maybe find a blog post telling you what is new, but no clue how to change anything as the settings are nonexistent. I‚Äôm stepping away from the app for a while until the team figures out where they are going with it and when they become more transparent I may return.

title: Boring Algoritm & Feed
text: It was great when I first joined. Saw all of my friends posts, then came the brands. Now my feed is full of unwanted content. Boring brands and influencers reposting the same dried up memes from other apps. I just was my feed to be showing the people I follow and then I‚Äôll be happy! Also, DMs, a trending tab, and a way to see posts I‚Äôve liked in the past. I‚Äôll see a really good post, like it, and then never see it again?

title: Shameless.
text: This is what Facebook always wanted to be. You have absolutely no control over your feed. You have no say in whose content appears in it. You can‚Äôt sort it chronologically. So if you follow an account, their content is thrown haphazardly and in random order into the shuffle, to fight it out in the cacophony of content you never expressed interest in that is nevertheless demanding your attention. It‚Äôs staggering that Meta is still this shameless after being called out for deliberately making their media addictive and destructive.

title: Fantastic app
text: I'm absolutely thrilled about this new app! It has brought me so much joy and excitement. I've been thoroughly enjoying my time with it, and I must say, things have been going exceptionally well. Threads has truly exceeded my expectations so far, and I can't wait to see what other amazing experiences it has in store for me!

title: Great app!
text: Really enjoying this app. I LOVE that it‚Äôs nothing like Tik Tok and that there‚Äôs less videos in my feed. You don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre just scroll, scroll, scrolling all the time. One thing I wish they would change is for my feed to not consist of people I don‚Äôt follow. I want my feed to only show the accounts I follow. Other than that, I think this app is a hit.

title: Great place to spend some time!
text: Speaking from my personal experiences only, this is a much more accurate, inclusive, and better curated app than its main competitor. Hate speech isn‚Äôt tolerated, and conspiracy doesn‚Äôt rule the world. I highly recommend anyone turned off by what Twitter has become, try this platform.

title: Help

title: Still more to be added but be patient!!
text:
After a few days, it‚Äôs amazing. Yes, there‚Äôs still more to be added. BUT people need to realize it takes time and this app isn‚Äôt completely finished yet. 
And even tho the algorithm isn‚Äôt so good for me, I believe that‚Äôll change at least a little bit when things like hashtags are added!!

title: Please Add a Trending Page
text: Hi Meta, I really like how simple and intuitive the UI is for this app. Though, I think this app desperately needs a ‚Äútrending page‚Äù where you can see any big events or news at a glance like how you can on twitter. This would definitely help drive more people away from twitter and onto your platform.

title: Had a great start, but now falling apart
text:
Dictation of posts in Threads no longer works, very irritating.
Engagement is so vanilla it‚Äôs bro boring. I want this app to feed me all the breaking news but it‚Äôs really hard to get a good news experience as a regular user. Algorithm overrides what I want to see into what Zuck wants me to see and it‚Äôs kind of gross.
I was hoping this would be Twitter 2.0 but bluesky feels a whole lot more like old Twitter by comparison. The trouble with that app is the population is still very small.

title: Great app, needs work
text: It‚Äôs a good rival to Twitter. Twitter has been on a downwards trend for a little while now and I‚Äôm glad to see competition emerge. It was definitely rushed out to capitalize on Twitters Rate Limit issues, but I genuinely believe Threads can be the next big Twitter replacement, but it needs a little time. I‚Äôll be rooting for it from the sidelines.

title: Cheap wannabe Twitter
text: Twitter already exists. This a worse-made clone. Different platforms are supposed to be different. It is more wonky than Twitter and has a worse user interface. There is no option to just see the threads of people you follow, leading the page to be filled with recommendations that are not interesting. Also, this does not need to be its own app. If it was an added feature to the Instagram app, it would make more sense, but unfortunately that is not the case. It wants to be Twitter but comes off as an underdeveloped cheap knockoff.

title: Search Function PLEASE
text: Can you revise the search function so we can search for accounts, or tags, or words mentioned in posts. It‚Äôs hard to discover if you‚Äôre deciding what we see and there‚Äôs no way to search for people with common interests. Otherwise a solid start to an app and I can‚Äôt wait to see what improvements are added.

title: Not a fan of how many suggestions
text:
Critique on threads. Something I didn‚Äôt like about Twitter either, is the amount suggestions on the home page. I like how instagram prioritizes who you follow. On threads, I see them for 1 minute, and then suggestions take over. Not a fan

Plus is that there are parental controls of types of words that it will allow. You can filter out swears that you would rather not see.

title: Needs some features but has potential!
text: This app is honestly pretty great so far but it‚Äôs just missing some key features! (Following tab, Dms, viewing your likes, a trending or explore page, hashtags etc. It really feels like a peaceful and fun app to use please don‚Äôt change the feel of it, otherwise people are gonna drop off and not come back.

title: Too much antisemitism and anti-Israel hate!
text:
I love the app, but there is a big problem!  People don‚Äôt seem to understand that if they don‚Äôt have anything nice to say, that they should keep their mouths shut. I‚Äôve been targeted by people with antisemitism and anti-Israel comments and I have had ENOUGH!

Please do something to stop this hate speech from spreading so much! It‚Äôs disgusting and unacceptable, and intolerable! I just want to be on a social media platform free of hate speech towards my community as a Jewish individual. üò≠üò°üò©

title: A clear copy of Twitter to push propaganda
text: As a life long democrat and someone who was raised in a very liberal household I just want to say we don‚Äôt need to make this app so political. This app is just left wing propaganda and talking points and plenty of disinformation. It‚Äôs almost as if this was to go against twitters shift to right wing extremism. So now I have 2 apps that are ideologically the same but with worse content than ever before. Like I said too I am a hardcore democrat I just think we need to stop making these apps so political it‚Äôs bad for society.
